Wendell Bell (September 27, 1924 – November 8, 2019) was a futurist and sociologist. He was the Professor Emeritus of Sociology at Yale University. His work area were sociology, social class, race, family life and future studies. He founded the Yale Program of African American Studies. He retired in 1995.
Bell died on November 8, 2019 at the age of 95.
